div.p: Greetings. As I was about to seal the letters addressed to you around 2 o'clock in the afternoon, behold, the man from Locarno is here and offers me your latest along with the decrees of the 6th session and the speech of Lotteringen, which I am returning because I had previously received it in print.
And I give you my greatest thanks.
Work for the 7th session, so that we may see what the disorderly men have ordained about order.
The things they have decreed about the mass are most ridiculous; a lid worthy of the pot.
